timeline.title: Earth Summit in Rio de Janeiro
timeline.summary: The United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) was adopted, setting the foundation for international climate policy cooperation.
timeline.keyInsight: First major international agreement acknowledging the need to stabilize greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere.

timeline.title: Kyoto Protocol Adopted
timeline.summary: The Kyoto Protocol was adopted, committing industrialized nations to binding greenhouse gas emission reduction targets.
timeline.keyInsight: First binding treaty with specific emissions targets for developed countries, though without commitments from major developing nations.

timeline.title: Kyoto Protocol Enters Into Force
timeline.summary: The Kyoto Protocol officially entered into force after Russian ratification, requiring countries to begin implementing policies to meet their emission targets.
timeline.keyInsight: Implementation phase began, though the absence of the United States limited global effectiveness.

timeline.title: Copenhagen Accord
timeline.summary: The Copenhagen Climate Change Conference resulted in the Copenhagen Accord, which recognized the need to limit global temperature increases to 2째C above pre-industrial levels.
timeline.keyInsight: Shifted focus from binding emissions targets to temperature goals, but was criticized for lack of legal enforcement mechanisms.

timeline.title: Paris Agreement Adoption
timeline.summary: The Paris Agreement was adopted, with nearly all countries pledging to limit global warming to well below 2째C and to pursue efforts to limit it to 1.5째C.
timeline.keyInsight: Landmark agreement introducing nationally determined contributions (NDCs) as the primary mechanism for climate commitments.

timeline.title: United States Announces Paris Agreement Withdrawal
timeline.summary: The Trump administration announced the intention to withdraw the United States from the Paris Agreement, creating uncertainty in global climate governance.
timeline.keyInsight: Demonstrated the vulnerability of international climate agreements to national political shifts.

timeline.title: United States Rejoins Paris Agreement
timeline.summary: The Biden administration officially rejoined the Paris Agreement on its first day in office, reestablishing the United States as part of the global climate effort.
timeline.keyInsight: Highlighted the importance of sustained political commitment to climate agreements across administrations.

timeline.title: COP28 and Global Stocktake
timeline.summary: The COP28 conference conducted the first global stocktake under the Paris Agreement, revealing a significant gap between current policies and the emission reductions needed to meet Paris goals.
timeline.keyInsight: First formal assessment showed current policies would lead to 2.8째C warming, far above the Paris Agreement targets.
